name: df-crcts
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2
body: |- wceq(ccrcts, cmpt(s0, universe, copab(s1, s2, wa(wbr(cv(s1), cfv(ctrls, cv(s0)), cv(s2)), wceq(cfv(cv(s2), nat0), cfv(cv(s2), cfv(chash, cv(s1))))))))
comment: Define the set of all circuits (in an undirected graph). According to Wikipedia ("Cycle (graph theory)", ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cycle_(graph_theory) , 3-Oct-2017): "A circuit can be a closed walk allowing repetitions of vertices but not edges"; according to Wikipedia ("Glossary of graph theory terms", ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Glossary_of_graph_theory_terms, 3-Oct-2017): "A circuit may refer to ... a trail (a closed tour without repeated edges), ...". Following Bollobas ("A trail whose endvertices coincide (a closed trail) is called a circuit.", see Definition of [Bollobas] p. 5.), a circuit is a closed trail without repeated edges. So the circuit is also represented by the following sequence: p(0) e(f(1)) p(1) e(f(2)) ... p(n-1) e(f(n)) p(n)=p(0). (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 3-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 31-Jan-2021.)
